Description: Added support for resolving dynamic links to source files in Markdown documents
You can now specify sidebar item priorities by adding a numeric prefix to documentation page source file names
Added a new `\Hyde\Framework\Exceptions\ParseException` exception class to handle parsing exceptions in data collection files
Added a new `\Hyde\Framework\Exceptions\InvalidConfigurationException` exception class to handle invalid configuration exceptions
Added support for setting custom navigation items in the YAML configuration
Added support for setting extra attributes for navigation items
Introduced a new navigation config builder class to simplify navigation configuration
Added support for setting `booting()` and `booted()` callbacks in `HydeExtension` classes, allowing extension developers to hook into the kernel boot process more easily
You can now add custom posts to the blog post feed component when including it directly
Added a `Feature::fromName()` enum helper
Added support for specifying features in the YAML configuration
Added environment variable support for saving previews
Added support for setting the blog post publishing date as a prefix in the source file name
Added Vite as a build tool
Added a Vite HMR support for the realtime compiler
Added Vite facade
Added a custom Blade-based heading renderer for Markdown conversions
The `publish:views` command is now interactive on Unix-like systems
Added support for PHP 8.4
Added a new Hyde Vite plugin
Added a new simplified blog post image front matter schema using a new "caption" field
Added a new `\Hyde\Framework\Actions\PreBuildTasks\TransferMediaAssets` build task to handle media assets transfers for site builds.
The `\Hyde\Facades\Features` class is no longer marked as internal, and is now thus part of the public API.
Added new `npm run build` command for compiling frontend assets with Vite
The documentation article component now supports disabling the semantic rendering using a falsy value
Navigation menu items are now no longer filtered by duplicates (meaning two items with the same label can now exist in the same menu)
Changed the default build task message to make it more concise
Calling the `Include::path()` method will no longer create the includes directory
Data collection files are now validated for syntax errors during discovery
Calling the `DataCollection` methods will no longer create the data collections directory

Markdown includes are now converted to HTML using the custom HydePHP Markdown service, meaning they now support full GFM spec and custom Hyde features like colored blockquotes and code block filepath labels
Markdown returned from includes are now trimmed of trailing whitespace and newlines
Methods in the `Includes` facade now return `HtmlString` objects instead of `string`
Details: For more information, see below.

Description: `Includes::path()` and `Includes::get()` methods now normalize paths to be basenames to match the behavior of the other include methods
Details: This means that nested directories are no longer supported, as you should use a data collection for these

Description: The `route` function will now throw a `RouteNotFoundException` if the route does not exist
The `processing_time_ms` attribute in the `sitemap.xml` file has now been removed
Improved the sitemap data generation to be smarter and more dynamic
Skipped build tasks will now exit with an exit code of 3 instead of 0
Updated the `Hyde::url()` helper throw a `BadMethodCallException` instead `BaseUrlNotSetException` when no site URL is set and no path was provided to the method
Overhauled the blog post author feature
Updated the blog post layout and post feed component to use the `BlogPosting` Schema.org type instead of `Article`
Added more rich markup data to blog post components
Details: (Note that this inevitably changes the HTML output of the blog post components, and that any customized templates will need to be republished to reflect these changes)

Description: The build command now groups together all `InMemoryPage` instances under one progress bar group
The `Markdown::render()` method will now always render Markdown using the custom HydePHP Markdown service (thus getting smart features like our Markdown processors)
Improved the media asset transfer build task to have better output
Improved how the `MarkdownService` class is accessed by binding it into the service container
Renamed the `hyde.enable_cache_busting` configuration option to `hyde.cache_busting`
Updated default configuration to no longer save previewed pages
The realtime compiler now only serves assets from the media source directory (`_media`), and no longer checks the site output directory (`_site/media`)
Replaced `--run-dev` and `--run-prod` build command flags with a single `--run-vite` flag that uses Vite to build assets
Moved the Vite build step to run before the site build to prevent duplicate media asset transfers
Replaced HydeFront styles with Tailwind
The full page documentation search now generates its heading using smarter natural language processing based on the configured sidebar header
Moved Blade view `hyde::pages.documentation-search` to `hyde::pages.docs.search`
Normalized default Tailwind Typography Prose code block styles to match Torchlight's theme, ensuring consistent styling across Markdown and Torchlight code blocks
Extracted CSS component partials in HydeFront
Colored Markdown blockquotes are now rendered using Blade and TailwindCSS
Details: This change is not visible in the rendered result, but the HTML output has changed

Description: We now support PHP 8.2–8.4 instead of 8.1–8.3
We upgraded from the TailwindCSS version from v3 to v4
Details: You may want to run `npx @tailwindcss/upgrade` in your project if you have custom Tailwind classes in your project. See the information below for details.

Description: We switched from using CJS to ESM in the frontend tool scaffolding. If you have custom script includes you need to migrate them. See below and the pull request for details.
Renamed the parameter `category` to `group` in the `publish:views` command
The navigation system internals have been rewritten into a new Navigation API
Details: This change is breaking for custom navigation implementations. For more information, see below.

Description: The `hyde.features` configuration format has changed to use Enums instead of static method calls
Details: For more information, see below.

Description: Renamed class `DataCollections` to `DataCollection`.
Details: For more information, see below.

Description: The `hyde.authors` config setting should now be keyed by the usernames.
Details: For more information, see below.

Description: The `Author::create()` method now returns an array instead of a `PostAuthor` instance.
Details: For more information, see below.

Description: The `Author::get()` method now returns `null` if an author is not found, rather than creating a new instance.
Details: For more information, see below.

Description: The custom navigation item configuration now uses array inputs instead of the previous format.
Details: For more information, see the upgrade guide below.

Description: Renamed the `hyde.navigation.subdirectories` configuration option to `hyde.navigation.subdirectory_display`.
Upgraded from Laravel 10 to Laravel 11
Updated minimum PHP requirement to 8.2
Updated Symfony/yaml to ^7.0
Updated illuminate/support and illuminate/view to ^11.0
Switched to forked version of the Torchlight client
Due to changes in the navigation system, it is possible that existing configuration files will need to be adjusted in order for menus to look the same (in terms of ordering etc.)
The `hasFeature` method on the Hyde facade and HydeKernel now only accepts a Feature enum value instead of a string for its parameter.
Changed how the documentation search is generated, to be an `InMemoryPage` instead of a post-build task.
Media asset files are now copied using the new build task instead of the deprecated `BuildService::transferMediaAssets()` method.
Reorganized and cleaned up the navigation and sidebar documentation for improved clarity.
Moved the sidebar documentation to the documentation pages section for better organization.
Added missing collection key types in Hyde facade method annotations
The `app.js` file will now only be compiled if it has scripts
The `app.css` file will no longer be copied to the media output directory when app styles are configured to be loaded from a CDN
Internal: Removed the internal `DocumentationSearchPage::generate()` method as it was unused
Removed the deprecated global `unslash()` function, replaced with the namespaced `\Hyde\unslash()` function
Removed the deprecated `BaseUrlNotSetException` class, with the `Hyde::url()` helper now throwing `BadMethodCallException` if no base URL is set
Removed: The deprecated `PostAuthor::getName()` method is now removed
Details: (use `$author->name`)

Description: Removed the deprecated `FeaturedImage::isRemote()` method
Details: Use `Hyperlinks::isRemote()` instead.

Description: Removed the `DocumentationPage::hasTableOfContents()` method as it is now unused by the framework
Removed Laravel Mix as a dependency
Details: (replaced with Vite)

Description: Removed the `.torchlight-enabled` CSS class
Removed The `hyde.css` file from HydeFront  as all styles were refactored to Tailwind
Removed the `DocumentationPage::getTableOfContents()` method as we now use Blade to generate the table of contents
Removed the `MarkdownService::withPermalinks` method
Removed the `MarkdownService::canEnablePermalinks` method
Removed support for PHP 8.1
Removed `npm run prod` command (replaced with `npm run build`)
Removed the build task `\Hyde\Framework\Actions\PostBuildTasks\GenerateSearch`
Details: See upgrade guide below

Description: Removed the deprecated `\Hyde\Framework\Services\BuildService::transferMediaAssets()` method
Details: See upgrade guide below

Description: **Added a new consolidated Asset API to better handle media files.**
Details: - Added several new fluent methods to the `MediaFile` class, like `getLink()`, `getLength()`, `getMimeType()`, etc.PHP_EOL- Added new `HydeFront` facade to handle CDN links and Tailwind config injection.PHP_EOL- Added method `Asset::exists()` to check if a media file exists.PHP_EOL- Added a `Hyde::assets()` method to get all media file instances in the site.

Description: **Many MediaFile related helpers have been changed or completely rewritten** to provide a simplified API for interacting with media files.
Details: - **Note:** For most end users, the changes will have minimal direct impact, but if you have custom code that interacts with media files, you may need to update it.PHP_EOL- The `Asset` facade has been restructured to be more scoped and easier to use, splitting out a separate `HydeFront` facade and inlining the `AssetService` class.PHP_EOL- All asset retrieval methods now return a `MediaFile` instance, which can be fluently interacted with, or cast to a string to get the link (which was the previous behavior).PHP_EOL- The `Hyde::asset()` method and `asset()` function now return `MediaFile` instances instead of strings, and will throw an exception if the asset does not exist.PHP_EOL- Renamed method `Asset::hasMediaFile` to `Asset::exists` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1957PHP_EOL- Renamed method `MediaFile::getContentLength` to `MediaFile::getLength` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1904PHP_EOL- Replaced method `Hyde::mediaPath` with `MediaFile::sourcePath` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1911PHP_EOL- Replaced method `Hyde::siteMediaPath` with `MediaFile::outputPath` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1911PHP_EOL- An exception will now be thrown if you try to get a media file that does not exist in order to prevent missing assets from going unnoticed in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1932PHP_EOL

Description: **MediaFile performance improvements:**
Details: - Media assets are now cached in the HydeKernel, giving a massive performance boost and making it easier to access the instances in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1917PHP_EOL- Media file metadata is now lazy loaded and then cached in memory, providing performance improvements for files that may not be used in a build in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1933PHP_EOL- We now use the much faster `CRC32` hashing algorithm instead of `MD5` for cache busting keys in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1918

Description: **Replaced Laravel Mix with Vite for frontend asset compilation**
Details: - **Breaking:** You must now use `npm run build` to compile your assets, instead of `npm run prod`PHP_EOL- Bundled assets are now compiled directly into the `_media` folder, and will not be copied to the `_site/media` folder by the NPM command in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/2011

Description: Markdown headings are now compiled using our custom Blade-based heading renderer
Details: - The `id` attributes for heading permalinks have been moved from the anchor to the heading element in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/2052

Description: **Improved Routes facade API with more intuitive method names**
Details: - **Breaking:** Renamed `Routes::get()` to `Routes::find()` to better indicate it may return nullPHP_EOL- **Breaking:** Renamed `Routes::getOrFail()` to `Routes::get()` to make the exception-throwing behavior the default and match Laravel conventionsPHP_EOL- This change requires code updates if you were using these methods - see upgrade guide below

Description: **Ported the HydeSearch plugin used for the documentation search to be an Alpine.js implementation**
Details: - Renamed Blade component `hyde::components.docs.search-widget` to `hyde::components.docs.search-modal` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/2029PHP_EOL- Added support for customizing the search implementation by creating a `resources/js/HydeSearch.js` file in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/2031

Description: **With the new Asset API, a few features had to be moved/removed:**
Details: - `AssetService` class has been removed (was merged into the `Asset` facade) in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1908PHP_EOL- Removed HydeFront methods from the `Asset` facade (moved to the new HydeFront facade) in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1907PHP_EOL- The config options `hyde.hydefront_version` and `hyde.hydefront_cdn_url` have been removed in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1909 (as changing these could lead to incompatible asset versions, defeating the feature's purpose)PHP_EOL- Removed `Hyde::mediaLink()` method replaced by `Hyde::asset()` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1932PHP_EOL- Removed `Hyde::mediaPath()` method replaced by `MediaFile::sourcePath()` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1911PHP_EOL- Removed `Hyde::siteMediaPath()` method replaced by `MediaFile::outputPath()` in https://github.com/hydephp/develop/pull/1911

Description: **Removed CDN include for the HydeSearch plugin replaced by Alpine.js implementation**
Details: - This also removes the `<x-hyde::docs.search-input />` and `<x-hyde::docs.search-scripts />` Blade components, replaced by the new `<x-hyde::docs.hyde-search />` component.
